adrFormatAddress: 449 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10016-6026, USA

originalText.text:
Stopped in after a  Candlelight Crossroads Concert and had a lovely time. Atmosphere was nice, staff was attentive and friendly (although I didn't get his name) our waiter was courteous and helpful.
We decided on small plates & dined on lamb skewers, feta stuffed eggplant and grilled  shrimp, octopus and calamari all of which were delicious, presented well and the right temperature!
For drinks we sipped on Sikko & some kinda fig drink that was perfect & not too sweet
When in the city, I'd definitely visit again ☺️

originalText.text: I had an amazing brunch experience at this restaurant. The unlimited mimosas and delicious pancakes with salmon Benedict were a real treat. Our server, Marco, To Earth, provided excellent service throughout our meal. I highly recommend this place for a delightful brunch.

text.text: I had an amazing brunch experience at this restaurant. The unlimited mimosas and delicious pancakes with salmon Benedict were a real treat. Our server, Marco, To Earth, provided excellent service throughout our meal. I highly recommend this place for a delightful brunch.

originalText.text:
Went to Meze Mazi for the first time last night and although the food was good, the overall experience was not that enjoyable. We had a reservation for 3 people and when we arrived the table was only set for 2 people which makes no sense to me but we brushed it off. The waiter kept disappearing so when the salad came, one person still had no utensil or plate so we just walked up to the bar area and grabbed from there.

It’s about 20 degrees in NYC and the restaurant was so cold. We asked the waiter if they could raise the heat and he said yes but we froze all night while we were there. Our water glasses were empty and we had to ask to get a refill, and then a while after my friend asked for an additional refill and he only refilled her cup meanwhile the other 2 cups were getting empty as well. In my experience from eating out and just basic customer service, you refill all glasses or at least ask the other guests if they would like their water refilled as well. For us it just seemed like basic service skills were lacking.

originalText.text: We had a wonderful meal here last night. Both the salmon and the Branzini (Lavraki?) were amazing. My Branzini was really the best I've ever had anywhere. Prefectly grilled and crispy top and bottom. A whole fish the size of the plate. We also had the green beans and Greek lemon potatoes as sides. The Grilled octopus app was really good too as was the dessert of Galakto. Usually I don't like Greek desserts because they're a bit too sticky sweet.  This wasn't. Very good. As was our Server Marco who helped to make the evening perfect.

originalText.text: Our party of 7 was seated promptly even without reservation on a Saturday afternoon. The interior and the vibe is really pretty. Our sever was great as well. We ordered from the brunch menu and the deal of getting one drink coffee/juice/cocktail free was great. The food was great. The french toast was my favorite, perfect amount of sweetness and so fluffy.
